plugin.name: Calculator
plugin.author: Nick Gammon
plugin.description:
To calculate something enter "=" followed by an expression which can be evaluated by Lua.
eg.
= 2 + 2 (prints 4)
= sqrt (64) (prints 8)
The functions in the math, bit, string, utils and world libraries can be used without prefixing them with the library name.
eg.
= GetWorldID () = match ("fruit", "u") = shl (4, 4)
In addition, you can use hex, oct, bin functions to convert to those bases for printing.
eg.
= hex (1234) = oct (5678) = bin (15)

alias.send:
-- useful number conversions bit.hex = function (num) return bit.tostring (num, 16) end bit.oct = function (num) return bit.tostring (num, 8) end bit.bin = function (num) return bit.tostring (num, 2) end
print ("%1 =", setfenv (assert (loadstring "return %1"), setmetatable ({}, {__index = function (_, n) return math [n] or bit [n] or string [n] or utils [n] or world [n] end}) ) () )
